articles.headline: Economies in Latin America Race Ahead
articles.snippet: With recovery fragile elsewhere, Latin America benefits from strong commodity demand and past economic measures.
articles.abstract: With recovery fragile elsewhere, Latin America benefits from strong commodity demand and past economic measures.
articles.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru  While the United States and Europe fret over huge deficits and threats to a fragile recovery, this region has a surprise in store. Latin America, beset in the past by debt defaults, currency devaluations and the need for bailouts from rich countries, is experiencing robust economic growth that is the envy of its northern counterparts.

articles.headline: Top French Schools, Asked to Diversify, Fear for Standards
articles.snippet: The ideal of  race-blind meritocracy is being tested by the efforts at the elite universities that produce the nation’s leaders.
articles.abstract: The ideal of  race-blind meritocracy is being tested by the efforts at the elite universities that produce the nation’s leaders.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS  France is embarking on a grand experiment  how to diversify the overwhelmingly white “grandes écoles,” the elite universities that have produced French leaders in every walk of life  and Rizane el-Yazidi is one of the pioneers.

articles.headline: Banned Trailers Return for Latest Gulf Disaster
articles.snippet: Despite high levels of formaldehyde, some government trailers used after Katrina are getting a second life.
articles.abstract: Despite high levels of formaldehyde, some government trailers used after Katrina are getting a second life.
articles.lead_paragraph: VENICE, La.  In the wake of Hurricane Katrina, they became a symbol of the government’s inept response to that disaster: the 120,000 or so trailers provided by the Federal Emergency Management Agency to people who had lost their homes.

articles.headline: Google to Add Pay to Cover a Tax for Same-Sex Benefits
articles.snippet: Google will raise the salaries of gay and lesbian employees whose partners receive domestic partner benefits, to compensate them for a tax they pay that heterosexual married couples do not.
articles.abstract: Google will raise the salaries of gay and lesbian employees whose partners receive domestic partner benefits, to compensate them for a tax they pay that heterosexual married couples do not.
articles.lead_paragraph: Working for a company as rich as Google comes with an incredible number of fringe benefits: the free food, the free laundry, the doctor on duty at company headquarters and the impressive five months of maternity leave with full pay and benefits, to mention a few.
